1.verse: The genealogy of Christ and marriage of his mother Mary. The angel satisfies Joseph’s mind. This is the account of the genealogy of Jesus Christ, the son of David, the son also of Abraham:

2.verse: Abraham begat Isaac; Isaac begat Jacob; Jacob begat Judah and his brethren.

3.verse: Judah begat Perez and Zerah by Tamar; Perez begat Hezron; Hezron begat Ram.

4.verse: Ram begat Amminadab; Amminadab begat Nashon; Nashon begat Salmon.

5.verse: Salmon begat Boaz by Rahab; Boaz begat Obed by Ruth; Obed begat Jesse.

6.verse: Jesse begat David the king; David the king begat Solomon, by her who was the wife of Uriah.

7.verse: Solomon begat Rehoboam; Rehoboam begat Abijah; Abijah begat Asa.

8.verse: Asa begat Jehoshaphat; Jehoshaphat begat Joram; Joram begat Uzziah.

9.verse: Uzziah begat Jotham; Jotham begat Ahaz; Ahaz begat Hezekiah.

10.verse: Hezekiah begat Manasseh; Manasseh begat Amon; Amon begat Josiah.

11.verse: Josiah begat Jeconiah and his brethren about the time they were carried away to Babylon.

12.verse: And after they were brought to Babylon, Jeconiah begat Shealtiel; Shealtiel begat Zerubbabel.

13.verse: Zerubbabel begat Abiud; Abiud begat Eliakim; Eliakim begat Azor.

14.verse: Azor begat Zadok; Zadok begat Achim; Achim begat Eliud.

15.verse: Eliud begat Eleazar; Eleazar begat Matthan; Matthan begat Jacob.

16.verse: Jacob begat Joseph the husband of Mary, of whom was born that Jesus that is called Christ.

17.verse: All the generations from Abraham to David are 14 generations. And from David to the captivity of Babylon are 14 generations. And from the captivity of Babylon to Christ are also 14 generations.

18.verse: The birth of Jesus Christ was this way: When his mother Mary was betrothed to Joseph, before they came to dwell together, she was found with child by the Holy Spirit.

19.verse: Then Joseph her husband, being an upright man, and loathe to make an example of her, was minded to put her away quietly.

20.verse: While he thought on these things, behold, the angel of the Lord appeared to him in a dream, saying, Joseph son of David, fear not to take unto you Mary your wife. For that which is conceived in her is of the Holy Spirit.

21.verse: She will bring forth a son, and you shall call his name Jesus. For he will save his people from their sins.

22.verse: All this was done to fulfil that which was spoken about the Lord by the prophet, saying,

23.verse: Behold, a maiden shall be with child, and shall bring forth a son, and they shall call his name Immanuel, which is by interpretation, God with us.

24.verse: And Joseph, as soon as he awoke out of sleep, did as the angel of the Lord had bid him, and took his wife unto him,

25.verse: and knew her not till she had brought forth her first son, and called his name Jesus.

1.verse: The time and place of Christ’s birth. The wise men offer their presents. Christ flees into Egypt. The young children are slain. Christ turns in to Galilee. When Jesus was born at Bethlehem in Judea, in the time of Herod the king, behold, there came wise men from the east to Jerusalem,

2.verse: saying, Where is he that is born king of the Jews? We have seen his star in the east and have come to worship him.

3.verse: When Herod the king heard this, he was troubled, and all Jerusalem with him.

4.verse: And he gathered all the chief priests and scribes of the people and asked of them where the Christ was to be born.

5.verse: And they said to him, At Bethlehem in Judea. For thus it is written by the prophet:

6.verse: And thou Bethlehem, in the land of Judea, are not the least among the princes of Judah, for out of you shall come the leader who will govern my people Israel.

7.verse: Then Herod privately called the wise men and carefully enquired of them when the star had appeared,

8.verse: and sent them to Bethlehem, saying, Go and search diligently for the child. And when you have found him, bring me word so that I may come and worship him also.

9.verse: When they had heard the king, they departed. And lo, the star which they saw in the east went before them, till it came and stood over the place where the child was.

10.verse: When they saw the star, they were marvellously glad,

11.verse: and went into the house and found the child with Mary his mother, and kneeled down and worshipped him, and opened their treasures and offered to him gifts: gold, frankincense, and myrrh.

12.verse: And after they were warned by God in a dream that they should not go again to Herod, they returned into their own country another way.

13.verse: When they had departed, behold, the angel of the Lord appeared to Joseph in a dream, saying, Arise, and take the child and his mother, and flee into Egypt, and remain there till I bring you word. For Herod will seek the child to kill him.

14.verse: Then he arose, and took the child and his mother by night, and departed into Egypt,

15.verse: and was there until the death of Herod, to fulfil that which was spoken of the Lord by the prophet, which says, Out of Egypt have I called my Son.

16.verse: Then Herod, perceiving that the wise men had gotten around him, was exceedingly angry, and sent forth and slew all the children that were in Bethlehem and in all its vicinity – as many as were two years old and under, according to the time that he had ascertained from the wise men.

17.verse: Then was fulfilled that which was spoken by the prophet Jeremiah, saying,

18.verse: On the hills a voice was heard, mourning, weeping, and great lamentation: Rachel weeping for her children. And she would not be comforted, because they were no more.

19.verse: When Herod was dead, behold, an angel of the Lord appeared in a dream to Joseph in Egypt,

20.verse: saying, Arise, and take the child and his mother, and go into the land of Israel. For they are dead who sought the child’s life.

21.verse: Then he arose up, and took the child and his mother, and came into the land of Israel.

22.verse: But when he heard that Archelaus was reigning in Judea in place of his father Herod, he was afraid to go there. After he was warned by God in a dream, he turned aside into the region of Galilee,

23.verse: and went and dwelt in a village called Nazareth, to fulfil that which was spoken by the prophets: He shall be called a Nazarite.

1.verse: The baptism, preaching, and office of John the Baptist, and how Christ was baptized by him in the Jordan. In those days John the Baptist came and preached in the wilderness of Judea,

2.verse: saying, Repent: the kingdom of heaven is at hand!

3.verse: This is he of whom it is spoken by the prophet Isaiah, who says, The voice of a crier in wilderness: Prepare the Lord’s way, and make his paths straight.

4.verse: This John had his garment of camel’s hair, and a girdle of skin about his loins. His food was locusts and wild honey.

5.verse: At that time Jerusalem and all Judea, and all the region round about the Jordan, went out to him,

6.verse: and were baptized by him in the Jordan, confessing their sins.

7.verse: When he saw many of the Pharisees and of the Sadducees come to his baptism, he said to them, O offspring of vipers, who has taught you to flee from the vengeance to come?

8.verse: Bring forth therefore the fruits belonging to repentance.

9.verse: And see that you ones do not think to say in yourselves, We have Abraham as our father. For I say to you that God is able from these stones to raise up children to Abraham.

10.verse: Even now is the axe put to the root of the trees, so that every tree which does not bring forth good fruit is hewn down and cast into the fire.

11.verse: I baptize you in water in token of repentance, but he who comes after me is mightier than I, whose shoes I am not worthy to bear. He will baptize you with the Holy Spirit and with fire.

12.verse: He has also his fan in his hand, and will purge his floor, and gather the wheat into his garner, and will burn the chaff with unquenchable fire.

13.verse: Then Jesus came from Galilee to the Jordan, to John, to be baptized by him.

14.verse: But John stopped him, saying, I ought to be baptized by you, and do you come to me?

15.verse: Jesus answered and said to him, Let it be so now, for thus it behoves us, to fulfil all righteousness. Then John let him.

16.verse: And Jesus, as soon as he was baptized, came straight out of the water. And lo, heaven was open over him, and John saw the Spirit of God descend like a dove and light upon him.

17.verse: And lo, there came a voice from heaven, saying, This is he: my beloved Son, in whom is my delight.

1.verse: Christ fasts and is proved. He calls Peter, Andrew, James, and John, and heals all the sick. Then Jesus was led away by the Spirit into wilderness, to be tried by the devil.

2.verse: And when he had fasted forty days and forty nights, he was afterwards hungered.

3.verse: Then the tempter came to him and said, If you are the Son of God, command that these stones be made bread.

4.verse: He answered and said, It is written: Man shall not live by bread alone, but by every word that proceeds out of the mouth of God.

5.verse: Then the devil took him up into the holy city and set him on a pinnacle of the temple,

6.verse: and said to him, If you are the Son of God, cast yourself down. For it is written: He will give his angels charge over you, and with their hands they will hold you up so that you do not dash your foot against a stone.

7.verse: And Jesus said to him, It is written also: You shall not tempt the Lord your God.

8.verse: The devil took him up again, and led him to an exceedingly high mountain, and showed him all the kingdoms of the world and all the glory of them,

9.verse: and said to him, All these I will give you, if you will fall down and worship me.

10.verse: Then Jesus said to him, Away, Satan! For it is written: You shall worship the Lord your God, and him only shall you serve.

11.verse: Then the devil left him, and behold, the angels came and ministered to him.

12.verse: Now when Jesus had heard that John was taken, he departed into Galilee.

13.verse: And leaving Nazareth, he went and dwelt in Capernaum, which is a city upon the sea in the coasts of Zebulun and Naphtali,

14.verse: to fulfil that which was spoken by Isaiah the prophet, saying,

15.verse: The land of Zebulun and Naphtali, by the way of the sea, beyond the Jordan, Galilee of the Gentiles:

16.verse: the people who sat in darkness saw great light, and to those who sat in the region and shadow of death, light has begun to shine.

17.verse: From that time Jesus began to preach and to say, Repent, for the kingdom of heaven is at hand!

18.verse: As Jesus walked by the Sea of Galilee, he saw two brethren, Simon who was called Peter, and Andrew his brother, casting a net into the sea, for they were fishermen.

19.verse: And he said to them, Follow me, and I will make you fishers of men.

20.verse: And they straightaway left their nets and followed him.

21.verse: And he went onwards from there and saw two other brethren, James the son of Zebedee and John his brother, in the boat with Zebedee their father, mending their nets. And he called them.

22.verse: And they without delay left the boat and their father, and followed him.

23.verse: And Jesus went about all Galilee, teaching in their synagogues and preaching the gospel of the kingdom. And he healed all manner of sickness and all kinds of diseases among the people.

24.verse: And his fame spread abroad throughout all Syria. And they brought to him all the sick people who were taken with divers diseases and torments, and those who were possessed with devils, and those who were mentally ill, and those who were paralyzed; and he healed them.

25.verse: And there followed him a great number of people from Galilee and the Ten Cities, and from Jerusalem and Judea, and from the regions that lie beyond the Jordan.

1.verse: In this chapter and the two next following is contained the most excellent and loving sermon of Christ in the Mount, which sermon is the very key that opens the understanding into the law. In this fifth chapter especially, he preaches of the 8 beatitudes, or blessings; of manslaughter, wrath, and anger; of adultery, of swearing, of suffering wrong; and of love, even toward a person’s enemies. When Jesus saw the crowds of people, he went up into a mountain. And when he was seated, his disciples came to him.

2.verse: And he opened his mouth and taught them, saying:

3.verse: Blessed are the poor in spirit, for theirs is the kingdom of heaven.

4.verse: Blessed are those who mourn, for they shall be comforted.

5.verse: Blessed are the meek, for they shall inherit the earth.

6.verse: Blessed are those who hunger and thirst for righteousness, for they shall be filled.

7.verse: Blessed are the merciful, for they shall obtain mercy.

8.verse: Blessed are the pure in heart, for they shall see God.

9.verse: Blessed are the peacemakers, for they shall be called the children of God.

10.verse: Blessed are those who suffer persecution for righteousness’ sake, for theirs is the kingdom of heaven.

11.verse: Blessed are you when men revile you, and persecute you, and falsely say all manner of evil things against you for my sake.

12.verse: Rejoice and be glad, for great is your reward in heaven. For in the same way they persecuted the prophets that were before your days.

13.verse: You are the salt of the earth. But if the salt has lost her saltness, what can be salted with it? It is thereafter good for nothing but to be cast out and to be trodden underfoot by men.

14.verse: You are the light of the world. A city that is set on a hill cannot be hid.

15.verse: Neither do men light a candle and put it under a bushel, but on a candlestick, and it gives light to all who are in the house.

16.verse: Let your light so shine before men that they may see your good works and glorify your Father who is in heaven.

17.verse: Do not think that I have come to destroy the law or the prophets. No, I have not come to destroy them, but to fulfil them.

18.verse: For truly I say to you, till heaven and earth perish, not one jot or one tittle of the law shall escape, till all be fulfilled.

19.verse: Whosoever breaks one of the least of these commandments, and teaches men so, he will be called the least in the kingdom of heaven. But whosoever observes and teaches them, the same will be called great in the kingdom of heaven.

20.verse: For I say to you, unless your righteousness exceeds the righteousness of the scribes and Pharisees, you cannot enter into the kingdom of heaven.

21.verse: You have heard how it was said to the people of the old time, You shall not kill. For whosoever kills will be liable to judgment.

22.verse: But I say to you, whosoever is angry with his brother will be liable to judgment. Whosoever says to his brother, Racha! will be liable to a council. But whosoever says, You fool! will be liable to hell fire.

23.verse: Therefore when you are offering your gift at the altar, and there remember that your brother has anything against you,

24.verse: leave your offering there before the altar, and go your way first and be reconciled to your brother; and then come and offer your gift.

25.verse: Reconcile with your adversary quickly while you are in the way with him, lest the adversary commit you to the judge, and the judge commit you to the officer, and then you be cast into prison.

26.verse: Truly I say to you, you will not come out of there till you have paid the last penny.

27.verse: You have heard how it was said to the people of the old time, You shall not commit adultery.

28.verse: But I say to you that whosoever looks on a wife, lusting after her, has committed adultery with her already in his heart.

29.verse: Therefore if your right eye causes you to offend, tear it out and cast it from you. It is better for you that one of your members perish than that your whole body should be cast into hell.

30.verse: Also, if your right hand causes you to offend, cut it off and cast it from you. Better it is that one of your members perish, than that all your body should be cast into hell.

31.verse: It is said, Whosoever puts away his wife, let him give her a testimonial also of the divorce.

32.verse: But I say to you, whosoever puts away his wife (unless it be for fornication), causes her to break matrimony. And whoever marries her who is divorced, breaks wedlock.

33.verse: Again, you have heard how it was said to the people of old time, Do not forswear yourself, but perform your oath to God.

34.verse: But I say to you, do not swear at all – neither by heaven, for it is God’s seat,

35.verse: nor yet by the earth, for it his footstool, nor by Jerusalem, for it is the city of that great king.

36.verse: Neither should you swear by your head, because you cannot make one hair white or black.

37.verse: But let your communication be yes, yes, and no, no. For whatever is more than that, comes of evil.

38.verse: You have heard how it is said, An eye for an eye, a tooth for a tooth.

39.verse: But I say to you, do not resist wrong. But whosoever gives you a blow on your right cheek, turn to him the other.

40.verse: And if any man would sue you at law and take away your coat, let him have your cloak also.

41.verse: And whoever would compel you to go a mile, go with him two.

42.verse: Give to him who asks, and from him who would borrow, turn not away.

43.verse: You have heard how it is said, You shall love your neighbour and hate your enemy.

44.verse: But I say to you, love your enemies. Bless those who curse you. Do good to those who hate you. Pray for those who do you wrong and persecute you,

45.verse: so that you may be the children of your Father that is in heaven. For he makes his sun to arise on the evil and on the good, and sends his rain on the just and the unjust.

46.verse: For if you love those who love you, what reward should you have? Do not the publicans do the same?

47.verse: And if you are friendly to your brethren only, what singular thing are you doing? Do not the publicans do likewise?

48.verse: You must therefore be perfect, even as your Father who is in heaven is perfect.

1.verse: Of alms, prayer, and fasting. Jesus forbids the care of seeking the things of this life. Take heed to your alms, that you do not give in the sight of men with the intent to be seen by them, or you will receive no reward from your Father who is in heaven.

2.verse: Whenever therefore you give your alms, do not make a trumpet to be blown before you, as the hypocrites do in the synagogues and in the streets in order to be praised by men. Truly I say to you, they have their reward.

3.verse: But when you give, let not your left hand know what your right hand does,

4.verse: so that your giving may be secret. And your Father who sees in secret will reward you openly.

5.verse: And when you pray, do not be as the hypocrites are. For they love to stand and pray in the synagogues and in the corners of the streets, because they want to be seen by men. Truly I say to you, they have their reward.

6.verse: But when you pray, enter into your chamber and shut the door to, and pray to your Father who is in secret. And your Father who sees in secret will reward you openly.

7.verse: And when you pray, do not use vain repetitions like the heathen do. For they think that they will be heard for their many words.

8.verse: Be not like them therefore. For your Father knows what you need before you ask of him.

9.verse: Pray therefore in this manner: O our Father who art in heaven, Hallowed be thy name.

10.verse: Thy kingdom come. Thy will be done on earth as it is in heaven.

11.verse: Give us this day our daily bread.

12.verse: And forgive us our trespasses, as we forgive them that trespass  against us.

13.verse: And lead us not into temptation, but deliver us from evil. For thine is the kingdom and the power and the glory forever. Amen.

14.verse: For if you forgive others their trespasses, your heavenly Father will also forgive you.

15.verse: But if you will not forgive others their trespasses, neither will your Father forgive you your trespasses.

16.verse: Moreover, when you fast, do not be sad like the hypocrites are. For they disfigure their faces so they may be seen by men, how they fast. Truly I say to you, they have their reward.

17.verse: But you, when you fast, anoint your head and wash your face,

18.verse: so that it does not appear to men that you are fasting, but to your Father who is in secret. And your Father who sees in secret will reward you openly.

19.verse: See that you do not gather for yourselves treasure upon the earth, where rust and moths destroy, and where thieves break in and steal.

20.verse: But gather treasures together in heaven, where neither rust nor moths destroy, and where thieves do not break in or steal.

21.verse: For wherever your treasure is, there will your hearts be also.

22.verse: The light of the body is your eye. Therefore if your eye is single, all your body will be full of light.

23.verse: But if your eye is bad, then all your body will be full of darkness. Therefore if the light that is in you is darkness, how great is that darkness!

24.verse: No one can serve two masters. For either he will hate the one and love the other, or else he will lean to the one and neglect the other. You cannot serve both God and mammon.

25.verse: Therefore I say to you, do not be anxious about your life, what you will eat or what you will drink, nor yet for your body, what you will put on. Is not life more than food, and the body more than clothing?

26.verse: Behold the birds of the air. They do not sow or reap or gather into barns, and yet your heavenly Father feeds them. Are you not of much more value than they?

27.verse: Which of you, though he took thought for it, could add one cubit to his stature?

28.verse: Why worry then about clothing? Consider the lilies of the field, how they grow. They do not labour or spin.

29.verse: And yet for all that, I say to you that even Solomon in all his royalty was not arrayed like one of these.

30.verse: Therefore if God so clothes the grass, which is today in the field and tomorrow will be cast into the furnace, will he not much more do the same for you, O ye of little faith?

31.verse: Therefore do not be anxious, saying, What will we eat? or, What will we drink? or, How will we be clothed?

32.verse: After all these things the Gentiles seek. For your heavenly Father knows that you have need of all these things.

33.verse: But rather seek ye first the kingdom of heaven and its righteousness, and all these things will be ministered unto you.

34.verse: Care not then for the morrow, but let the morrow care for itself. For the present day has ever enough of its own trouble.

1.verse: Jesus forbids foolish and presumptuous judgment, reproves hypocrisy, exhorts to prayer, warns us to beware of false prophets, and so concludes his sermon. Judge not, that you be not judged.

2.verse: For as you judge, so shall you be judged, and the measure you use will be measured back to you.

3.verse: Why do you see a speck in your brother’s eye, and not perceive the beam that is in your own eye?

4.verse: Or why do you say to your brother, Let me take the speck out of your eye, and behold, there is a beam in your own eye?

5.verse: Hypocrite, first cast the beam out of your own eye, and then you will see clearly to pluck the speck out of your brother’s eye.

6.verse: Do not give that which is holy to dogs, nor cast your pearls before swine, lest they tread them under their feet and then turn and tear you to shreds.

7.verse: Ask, and it will be given you. Seek, and you will find. Knock, and it will be opened to you.

8.verse: For whosoever asks, receives; and he who seeks, finds; and to him who knocks, it will be opened.

9.verse: Is there anyone among you who, if his son asked for bread, would offer him a stone?

10.verse: Or if he asked for fish, would give him a serpent?

11.verse: If then you who are evil know how to give good gifts to your children, how much more will your Father who is in heaven give good things to those who ask him?

12.verse: Therefore whatever you would have others do unto you, so do unto them. This is the law and the prophets.

13.verse: Enter in at the strait gate. For wide is the gate and broad is the way that leads to destruction, and many there are who go in at it.

14.verse: But strait is the gate and narrow is the way that leads to life, and few there are who find it.

15.verse: Beware of false prophets, who come to you in sheep’s clothing, but inwardly they are ravening wolves.

16.verse: You may know them by their fruits. Do men gather grapes from thorns, or figs from thistles?

17.verse: Likewise every good tree brings forth good fruit, but a corrupt tree brings forth bad fruit.

18.verse: A good tree cannot bring forth bad fruit, nor yet can a bad tree bring forth good fruit.

19.verse: Every tree that does not bring forth good fruit shall be hewn down and cast into the fire.

20.verse: Therefore by their fruits you may know them.

21.verse: Not all who say to me, Lord, Lord, will enter into the kingdom of heaven, but he who does the will of my Father who is in heaven.

22.verse: Many will say to me in that day, Lord, Lord, have we not prophesied in your name, and in your name have cast out devils, and in your name done many miracles?

23.verse: And then I will declare to them that I never knew them. Depart from me, ye workers of iniquity!

24.verse: Whosoever hears these sayings of mine and does them, I will liken him to a wise man who built his house on a rock.

25.verse: And much rain descended, and the floods came, and the winds blew and beat upon that same house; and it did not fall, because it was grounded on the rock.

26.verse: And whosoever hears these sayings of mine and does them not shall be likened to a foolish man who built his house upon the sand.

27.verse: And much rain descended, and the floods came, and the winds blew and beat upon that house, and it fell. And great was the fall of it.

28.verse: And it came to pass that when Jesus had ended these sayings, the people were astonished at his instruction.

29.verse: For he taught them as one having power, and not as the scribes.

1.verse: Christ cleanses the leper, heals the centurion’s servant, heals many other diseases, helps Peter’s mother-in-law, stills the sea and the wind, and drives the devils out of the possessed man into the swine. When Jesus came down from the mountain, crowds of people followed him.

2.verse: And lo, a leper came and worshipped him, saying, Master, if you are willing, you can make me clean.

3.verse: And Jesus put forth his hand and touched him, saying, I will; be clean! And immediately his leprosy was cleansed.

4.verse: And Jesus said to him, See that you tell no one, but go and show yourself to the priest, and offer the gift that Moses commanded, in witness to them.

5.verse: When Jesus had entered into Capernaum, there came to him a certain centurion, who besought him,

6.verse: saying, Master, my servant lies sick at home, paralyzed, and is grievously pained.

7.verse: And Jesus said to him, I will come and heal him.

8.verse: The centurion answered and said, Sir, I am not worthy that you should come under my roof. But speak the word only, and my servant shall be healed.

9.verse: For I also myself am a man subject to the authority of another, and have soldiers under me. And I say to one, Go! and he goes, and to another, Come! and he comes, and to my servant, Do this! and he does it.

10.verse: When Jesus heard that, he marvelled, and said to the people who followed him, Truly I say to you, I have not found such great faith, no, not in Israel.

11.verse: I say therefore to you that many will come from the east and west, and will rest with Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob in the kingdom of heaven,

12.verse: but the children of the kingdom shall be cast out into outer darkness; there will be weeping and gnashing of teeth.

13.verse: Then Jesus said to the centurion, Go your way, and as you believe, so be it unto you. And his servant was healed that very same hour.

14.verse: And then Jesus went to Peter’s house, and saw his wife’s mother lying sick of a fever,

15.verse: and touched her hand, and the fever left her. And she arose and ministered to them.

16.verse: When the evening was come, people brought to him many who were possessed with devils. And he cast out the spirits with a word, and healed all who were sick,

17.verse: to fulfil that which was spoken by Isaiah the prophet, saying, He took on him our infirmities, and bore our sicknesses.

18.verse: When Jesus saw crowds of people around him, he directed to go over the water.

19.verse: And a scribe came and said to him, Teacher, I will follow you wherever you go.

20.verse: And Jesus said to him, The foxes have holes, and the birds of the air have nests, but the Son of man has nowhere to rest his head.

21.verse: Another, who was one of his disciples, said to him, Master, first allow me to go and bury my father.

22.verse: But Jesus said to him, Follow me, and let the dead bury their own dead.

23.verse: And he entered into a boat, and his disciples followed him.

24.verse: And behold, there arose a great tempest in the sea, insomuch that the vessel was swamped with waves. And he was asleep.

25.verse: And his disciples came to him and awoke him, saying, Master, save us! We perish!

26.verse: And he said to them, Why are you fearful, O ye of little faith? Then he arose and rebuked the winds and the sea, and there followed a great calm.

27.verse: And the men marvelled and said, What man is this, that both winds and sea obey him?

28.verse: When Jesus had come to the other side, into the country of the Gergesenes, two men possessed by devils met him, coming out from among the graves. They were out of measure fierce, so that no one could pass by that way.

29.verse: And behold, they cried out, saying, O Jesus, Son of God, what have we to do with you? Have you come here to torment us before the time be come?

30.verse: And a good way off from them there was a great herd of swine feeding.

31.verse: Then the devils besought him, saying, If you cast us out, let us go our way into the herd of swine.

32.verse: And he said to them, Go your ways. Then they went out and dispersed into the herd of swine. And behold, the whole herd of swine was carried with violence headlong into the sea, and perished in the water.

33.verse: Then the herdsmen fled, and went their ways into the town and told everything, and what had happened to the men possessed by the devils.

34.verse: And all the town came out and met Jesus. And when they saw him, they besought him to depart from their shores.

1.verse: Jesus heals the paralytic, calls Matthew from receipt of custom, answers for his disciples, heals the woman with the issue of blood, helps Jairas’ daughter, gives two blind men their sight, and by driving out a devil makes a dumb man to speak. Then Jesus entered into a boat, and passed over and went into his own city.

2.verse: And lo, they brought to him a paralyzed man lying in his bed. And when Jesus saw their faith he said to the paralytic, Son, be of good cheer; your sins are forgiven you.

3.verse: And certain of the scribes said in themselves, This man blasphemes.

4.verse: When Jesus saw their thoughts, he said, Why do you think evil in your hearts?

5.verse: Which is easier to say: Your sins are forgiven you, or to say, Arise and walk?

6.verse: But so that you may know that the Son of man has power to forgive sins in earth– Then he said to the paralytic, Arise, take up your bed, and go home to your house.

7.verse: And the man arose and departed to his own house.

8.verse: And when the people saw it, they marvelled, and glorified God who had given such power to men.

9.verse: And as Jesus passed onwards from there, he saw a man named Matthew sitting at receipt of custom, and said to him, Follow me. And he arose and followed him.

10.verse: And it came to pass, as he sat at food in Matthew’s house, that many publicans and sinners came and sat down also with Jesus and his disciples.

11.verse: When the Pharisees saw this, they said to his disciples, Why does your teacher eat with publicans and sinners?

12.verse: When Jesus heard this, he said to them, The whole do not need the physician, but they that are sick.

13.verse: Go and learn what this means: I have pleasure in mercy, and not in offering. For I have not come to call the righteous, but sinners, to repentance.

14.verse: Then John’s disciples came to him, asking, Why do we and the Pharisees fast often, but your disciples do not fast?

15.verse: And Jesus said to them, Can the wedding children mourn as long as the bridegroom is with them? The time will come when the bridegroom shall be taken from them, and then they will fast.

16.verse: No one patches an old garment with a piece of new cloth. For then the new piece pulls away from the garment, and the tear is made greater.

17.verse: Neither do men put new wine into old wineskins, for then the skins burst, the wine runs out, and the vessels are destroyed. But they pour new wine into new wineskins, and so both are preserved together.

18.verse: While he was thus speaking to them, a certain leader came and did reverence to him, saying, My daughter is even now deceased. But come and lay your hand on her, and she will live.

19.verse: And Jesus arose and followed him with his disciples.

20.verse: And behold, a woman who had been diseased for 12 years with an issue of blood came up behind him and touched the hem of his vesture.

21.verse: For she said in herself, If I may touch but even his vesture only, I will be healed.

22.verse: Then Jesus, turning about and seeing her, said, Daughter, be of good comfort; your faith has made you whole. And she was healed even that same hour.

23.verse: And when Jesus came into the leader’s house and saw the minstrels and the people making a noise

24.verse: he said to them, All of you, go away, for the girl is not dead, but sleeping. And they laughed him to scorn.

25.verse: But as soon as the people were put outside, he went in and took her by the hand, and the girl arose.

26.verse: And news of this spread throughout all that land.

27.verse: And as Jesus departed from there, two blind men followed him, crying out and saying, O Son of David, have mercy on us!

28.verse: And when he had gone indoors, the blind men came to him. And Jesus said to them, Do you believe that I am able to do this? And they said to him, Yes, Lord.

29.verse: Then he touched their eyes, saying, According to your faith, be it unto you.

30.verse: And their eyes were opened. And Jesus charged them, saying, See that no one knows of this.

31.verse: But they, as soon as they had left, spread abroad his name throughout all the land.

32.verse: As they went out, behold, people brought to him a dumb man, possessed by a devil.

33.verse: And as soon as the devil was cast out, the mute spoke. And the people marvelled, saying, Never have such things been seen in Israel!

34.verse: But the Pharisees said, He casts out devils by the power of the chief devil.

35.verse: And Jesus went about all the towns and villages, teaching in their synagogues and preaching the glad tidings of the kingdom, and healing all manner of sickness and disease among the people.

36.verse: But when he saw the people, he had compassion on them, because they were worn and weak and scattered abroad, even as sheep having no shepherd.

37.verse: Then he said to his disciples, The harvest is great, but the labourers are few.

38.verse: Therefore pray the Lord of the harvest to send forth labourers into his harvest.

1.verse: Christ sends out his twelve apostles to preach among the Jews, gives them charge, teaches them, and strengthens them against persecution and trouble. And Jesus called his 12 disciples to him, and gave them power over unclean spirits, to cast them out, and to heal all manner of sicknesses and all manner of diseases.

2.verse: The names of the 12 apostles are these: the first Simon, called also Peter, and Andrew his brother; James the son of Zebedee, and John his brother;

3.verse: Philip and Bartholomew; Thomas, and Matthew the publican; James the son of Alphaeus, and Lebbaeus otherwise called Thaddaeus;

4.verse: Simon the Canaanite; and Judas Iscariot, who also betrayed him.

5.verse: These twelve Jesus sent out and charged, saying, Go not into the roads that lead to the Gentiles, and do not enter into the towns of the Samaritans.

6.verse: But go rather to the lost sheep of the house of Israel.

7.verse: Go and preach, saying, The kingdom of heaven is at hand!

8.verse: Heal the sick, cleanse the lepers, raise the dead, cast out the devils. Freely you have received; freely give again.

9.verse: Do not possess gold or silver or copper coins in your belts,

10.verse: nor yet a bag for your journey; neither two coats, nor shoes, nor yet a staff. For the workman is worthy to have his keep.

11.verse: In whatever city or town you enter, enquire who is worthy in it, and there remain till you leave.

12.verse: And when you come into a household, wish it well.

13.verse: And if the house is worthy, your peace will come upon it. But if it is not worthy, your peace will return to you again.

14.verse: And whoever will not receive you, nor will hear your preaching, when you depart out of that house or that town, shake off the dust from your feet.

15.verse: Truly I say to you, it will be easier for the land of Sodom and Gomorrah in the day of judgment than for that place.

16.verse: Behold, I send you forth as sheep among wolves. Be therefore wise as serpents and innocent as doves.

17.verse: Beware of men, for they will deliver you up to the councils, and will scourge you in their synagogues.

18.verse: And you will be brought to the head governors and kings for my sake, in witness to them and to the Gentiles.

19.verse: But when they deliver you up, do not be anxious about how or what you will speak, for it will be given you even in that same hour what you should say.

20.verse: For it is not you who speak, but the Spirit of your Father who speaks in you.

21.verse: Brother will betray brother to death, and the father the son. And children will arise against their fathers and mothers, and will put them to death.

22.verse: And you will be hated by all men for my name. But he who endures to the end shall be saved.

23.verse: When they persecute you in one place, flee into another. I tell you for a truth, you will not finish all the cities of Israel before the Son of man comes.

24.verse: The disciple is not above his teacher, nor yet the servant above his lord.

25.verse: It is enough for the disciple to be as his teacher is, and that the servant be as his lord is. If they have called the Lord of the house Beelzebub, how much more will they call those of his household so?

26.verse: Fear them not therefore. There is nothing so closed that it will not be opened, and nothing so hid that it will not be known.

27.verse: What I tell you in darkness, that speak in light. And what you hear in the ear, that preach on the house tops.

28.verse: And fear not those who kill the body, and are not able to kill the soul. But rather fear him who is able to destroy both soul and body into hell.

29.verse: Are not two sparrows sold for a copper coin? And yet none of them lights on the ground without your Father.

30.verse: And now all the hairs of your heads are numbered.

31.verse: Fear not therefore: you are of more value than many sparrows.

32.verse: Whosoever therefore acknowledges me before men, him will I acknowledge also before my Father who is in heaven.

33.verse: But whosoever denies me before men, him will I also deny before my Father who is in heaven.

34.verse: Think not that I have come to send peace into the earth. I came not to send peace, but a sword.

35.verse: For I have come to set a man at variance against his father, and the daughter against her mother, and the daughter-in-law against her mother-in-law.

36.verse: And a man’s enemies will be those of his own household.

37.verse: He who loves his father or mother more than me, is not meet for me. And he who loves his son or daughter more than me, is not meet for me.

38.verse: And he who does not take up his cross and follow me, is not meet for me.

39.verse: He who finds his life will lose it, and he who loses his life for my sake, will find it.

40.verse: He who receives you receives me, and he who receives me, receives him who sent me.

41.verse: He who receives a prophet in the name of a prophet will receive a prophet’s reward. And he who receives a righteous man in the name of a righteous man, will receive the reward of a righteous man.

42.verse: And whosoever gives one of these little ones to drink a cup of cold water only in the name of a disciple, I tell you of a truth, he shall not lose his reward.

1.verse: John the Baptist sends his disciples to Christ, who gives them their answer. He rebukes the unthankful cities, and lovingly exhorts people to take his yoke upon them. And when Jesus had made an end of instructing his twelve disciples, he went on from there to teach and to preach in their towns.

2.verse: When John, being in prison, heard about the works of Christ, he sent two of his disciples

3.verse: and asked him, Are you he that was to come, or should we look for another?

4.verse: Jesus answered and said to them, Go and tell John what you have heard and seen:

5.verse: the blind see, the lame walk, the lepers are cleansed, the deaf hear, the dead rise up again, and the glad tidings are preached to the poor.

6.verse: And blessed is the person who is not offended by me.

7.verse: And as they departed, Jesus began to speak to the people about John: What did you go out into the wilderness to see? Did you go to see a reed shaken with the wind?

8.verse: Or what did you go out to see? A man clothed in soft raiment? Behold, they that wear soft clothing are in kings' houses.

9.verse: But what did you go out to see? A prophet? Yes, I say to you, and more than a prophet.

10.verse: For this is he of whom it is written: Behold, I send my messenger before your face, who shall prepare your way before you.

11.verse: Truly I say to you, among the children of women none greater than John the Baptist has arisen. Notwithstanding, he who is less in the kingdom of heaven, is greater than he.

12.verse: From the time of John the Baptist to now, the kingdom of heaven is sorely pressed, and those who go to it with effort seize it for themselves.

13.verse: For all the prophets and the law prophesied with a view to the time of John.

14.verse: And also, if you will receive it, this is Elijah who was to come.

15.verse: He who has ears to hear, let him hear.

16.verse: But to what can I liken this generation? It is like children who sit in the market and call to their fellows,

17.verse: and say, We have piped to you, and you have not danced; we have mourned to you, and you have not sorrowed.

18.verse: For John came neither eating nor drinking, and they say he has the devil.

19.verse: The Son of man came eating and drinking, and they say, Here is a glutton and drinker of wine, and a friend of publicans and sinners! Nevertheless, wisdom is justified by her children.

20.verse: Then Jesus began to upbraid the places in which most of his miracles had been done, because they did not turn:

21.verse: Woe to you, Chorazin! Woe to you, Bethsaida! For if the miracles that were shown in you had been done in Tyre and Sidon, they would have repented long ago in sackcloth and ashes.

22.verse: But I say to you, it will be easier for Tyre and Sidon at the day of judgment than for you.

23.verse: And you Capernaum, who are lifted up to heaven, shall be brought down to hell. For if the miracles which have been done in you had been shown in Sodom, it would have remained to this day.

24.verse: But I say to you, it will be easier for the land of Sodom in the day of judgment than for you.

25.verse: At that time Jesus concluded and said, I praise you, O Father, Lord of heaven and earth, because you have hid these things from the wise and learned, and have revealed them to babes;

26.verse: Even so, Father, for so it pleased you.

27.verse: All things are given to me by my Father. And no one knows the Son but the Father; nor does anyone know the Father except the Son, and the person to whom the Son will reveal him.

28.verse: Come unto me, all ye that labour and are heavy-laden, and I will give you rest.

29.verse: Take my yoke upon you, and learn from me, for I am gentle and lowly in heart, and you will find rest for your souls.

30.verse: For my yoke is easy, and my burden is light.

1.verse: The disciples pluck the ears of grain. He defends them, heals the withered hand, helps the possessed man who was blind and dumb, rebukes the unfaithful who insist on having signs, and shows who are his brother, sister, and mother. At that time Jesus went through the grain on the Sabbath days. And his disciples were hungry, and began to pluck the ears of grain and to eat.

2.verse: When the Pharisees saw that, they said to him, Look, your disciples are doing that which is not lawful to do on the Sabbath day.

3.verse: He said to them, Have you not read what David did when he was hungry, and those also who were with him?

4.verse: How he entered into the house of God and ate the hallowed loaves, which were not lawful for him to eat, neither for those who were with him, but only for the priests?

5.verse: Or have you not read in the law how the priests in the temple break the Sabbath day, and yet are blameless?

6.verse: But I say to you that there is one here greater than the temple.

7.verse: So then if you had known what this means: I require mercy, and not sacrifice – you would never have condemned the innocent.

8.verse: For the Son of man is Lord even of the Sabbath day.

9.verse: And he departed from there and went into their synagogue.

10.verse: And behold, there was a man there who had a withered hand. And they asked him, saying, Is it lawful to heal on the Sabbath days? in order that they might accuse him.

11.verse: And he said to them, Which of you would it be, if he had a sheep fallen into a pit on the Sabbath day, that would not take it and lift it out?

12.verse: And of how much more value is a man than a sheep? Therefore it is lawful to do a good deed on the Sabbath days.

13.verse: Then he said to the man, Stretch forth your hand. And he stretched it forth. And it was made whole again like the other.

14.verse: Then the Pharisees went out and held a council against him, how they might destroy him.

15.verse: When Jesus knew that, he departed from there. And crowds of people followed him. And he healed them all,

16.verse: and charged them not to make him known,

17.verse: to fulfil that which was spoken by Isaiah the prophet, who says:

18.verse: Behold my child, whom I have chosen, my beloved in whom my soul delights. I will put my Spirit on him, and he shall show judgment to the Gentiles.

19.verse: He will not quarrel; he will not cry out; neither will anyone hear his voice in the streets.

20.verse: A bruised reed he will not break, and a flax that begins to burn he will not quench, till he sends forth judgment unto victory.

21.verse: And in his name shall the Gentiles trust.

22.verse: Then was brought to him one who was possessed with a devil, who was both blind and dumb. And Jesus healed him, so that he who had been blind and dumb both spoke and saw.

23.verse: And all the people were amazed and said, Is not this the Son of David?

24.verse: But when the Pharisees heard that, they said, This fellow drives the devils out no other way but by the help of Beelzebub, the chief of the devils.

25.verse: But Jesus knew their thoughts and said to them, Every kingdom divided within itself will be brought to nothing. Neither can any city or household divided against itself continue.

26.verse: So if Satan casts out Satan, then he is divided against himself. How then shall his kingdom endure?

27.verse: Also, if I by the help of Beelzebub cast out devils, by whose help do your children cast them out? Therefore they will be your judges.

28.verse: But if I cast out the devils by the Spirit of God, then the kingdom of God has come upon you.

29.verse: Or again, how can a man enter into a strong man’s house and forcibly take away his goods, unless he first binds the strong man? And then he plunders his house.

30.verse: He who is not with me, is against me, and he who does not gather with me, scatters abroad.

31.verse: So I say to you, all manner of sin and blasphemy may be forgiven men, but the blasphemy of the Spirit will not be forgiven men.

32.verse: And whosoever speaks a word against the Son of man, it may be forgiven him, but whosoever speaks against the Holy Spirit, it may not be forgiven him – no, neither in this world, nor in the world to come.

33.verse: Either judge the tree good, and its fruit correspondingly good, or else judge the tree evil, and its fruit evil also. For the tree is known by its fruit.

34.verse: O offspring of vipers, how can you speak good things when you yourselves are evil? For out of the abundance of the heart, the mouth speaks.

35.verse: A good man, out of the good treasure of his heart, brings forth good things. And an evil man, out of his evil treasure, brings forth evil things.

36.verse: But I say to you that for every idle word that men speak, they will give account at the day of judgment.

37.verse: For by your words you will be justified, and by your words you will be condemned.

38.verse: Then certain of the scribes and Pharisees answered, saying, Teacher, we would like to see a sign from you.

39.verse: He answered and said to them, The evil and adulterous generation seeks a sign, but there shall be no sign given to them except the sign of the prophet Jonah.

40.verse: For as Jonah was three days and three nights in the whale’s belly, so shall the Son of man be three days and three nights in the heart of the earth.

41.verse: The people of Ninevah will rise at the day of judgment with this nation and condemn it, for they reformed at the preaching of Jonah, and behold, one greater than Jonah is here.

42.verse: The queen of the south will rise at the day of judgment with this generation and will condemn them, for she came from the furthermost parts of the world to hear the wisdom of Solomon, and behold, one greater than Solomon is here.

43.verse: But when the unclean spirit has gone out of a man, he walks throughout dry places, seeking rest, and finds none.

44.verse: Then he says, I will return again into my house, the one I came out of. And when he comes back, he finds the house empty and swept and set in order.

45.verse: Then he goes his way and gets seven other spirits worse than himself, and so they enter in and dwell there. And the end of that man is worse than the beginning. That is how it will be with this evil nation.

46.verse: When Jesus was still speaking to the people, his mother and his brethren stood outside, desiring to speak with him.

47.verse: Then someone said to him, Look, your mother and your brethren are standing outside, and want to speak with you.

48.verse: He answered and said to the one that had told him, Who is my mother? or who are my brethren?

49.verse: And he stretched forth his hand over his disciples and said, Behold my mother and my brethren.

50.verse: For whosoever does the will of my Father who is in heaven, the same is my brother, sister, and mother.

1.verse: The parables of the seed, of the tares, of the mustard seed, of the leaven, of the treasure hid in the field, of the pearls, and of the net. The same day, Jesus went out of the house and sat by the sea side.

2.verse: And crowds of people gathered to him, so greatly that he went and sat in a boat, and all the people stood on the shore.

3.verse: And he spoke many things to them in similitudes, saying, Behold, the sower went forth to sow.

4.verse: And as he sowed, some seed fell by the wayside, and the birds came and devoured it up.

5.verse: Some fell on stony ground where it had not much earth, and it sprang up quickly, because it had no depth of earth;

6.verse: and when the sun was up, it caught heat, and for lack of rooting withered away.

7.verse: Some fell among thorns, and the thorns sprang up and choked it.

8.verse: But part fell in good ground, and brought forth good fruit: some a hundredfold, some sixtyfold, some thirtyfold.

9.verse: Whosoever has ears to hear, let him hear!

10.verse: And the disciples came and asked him, Why do you speak to them in parables?

11.verse: He answered and said to them, It is given to you to know the secrets of the kingdom of heaven, but to them it is not given.

12.verse: For whosoever has, to him will be given, and he will have abundance. But whosoever has not, from him shall be taken away even what he has.

13.verse: Therefore I speak to them in similitudes. For though they see, they see not. And hearing, they hear not, neither understand.

14.verse: And in them is fulfilled the prophecy of Isaiah, which prophecy says: With the ears you will hear, but will not understand, and with the eyes you will see, and will not perceive.

15.verse: For the hearts of this people have grown dull, and their ears are hard of hearing, and their eyes they have closed, lest they should see with their eyes and hear with their ears and understand with their hearts, and should turn, so that I might heal them.

16.verse: But blessed are your eyes, for they see, and your ears, for they hear.

17.verse: Truly I say to you that many prophets and righteous men have desired to see those things that you see, and have not seen them, and to hear those things that you hear, and have not heard them.

18.verse: Hear therefore the similitude of the sower.

19.verse: Whosoever hears the word of the kingdom and does not understand it, there comes the evil one, and catches away that which was sown in his heart; and this is he who received the seed by the wayside.

20.verse: But he who received the seed in the stony ground is the person who hears the word of God, and at once receives it with joy.

21.verse: Yet he has no roots in himself, and therefore endures but a season, for as soon as tribulation or persecution arises because of the word, at once he falls.

22.verse: He who received the seed among thorns is the person who hears the word of God, but the care of this world and the deceitfulness of riches choke the word, and so he is made unfruitful.

23.verse: But he who receives the seed in good ground is the person who hears the word and understands it; who also bears fruit and brings forth, some a hundredfold, some sixtyfold, and some thirtyfold.

24.verse: Another similitude he put forth to them, saying, The kingdom of heaven is like a man who sowed good seed in his field.

25.verse: But while people were sleeping, his enemy came and sowed tares among the wheat, and went his way.

26.verse: When the blade had sprung up and had brought forth fruit, then the tares appeared also.

27.verse: Then the servants went to the householder and said to him, Sir, did you not sow good seed in your field? Where then did the tares come from?

28.verse: He said to them, The envious man has done this. Then the servants said to him, Do you want us then to go and weed them out?

29.verse: But he said, Nay, lest while you go about to weed out the tares, you pluck up also with them the wheat by the roots.

30.verse: Let both grow together till harvest comes. And in the time of harvest I will say to the reapers, Gather the tares first, and bind them in sheaves to be burned; but gather the wheat into my barn.

31.verse: Another parable he put forth to them, saying, The kingdom of heaven is like a grain of mustard seed that a man takes and sows in his field,

32.verse: which is the least of all seeds. But when it is grown, it is the greatest among shrubs; and it is a tree, so that the birds of the air come and build in its branches.

33.verse: He told them another similitude: The kingdom of heaven is like leaven that a woman takes and hides in three measures of meal, till all is leavened.

34.verse: All these things Jesus spoke to the people by similitudes. And he spoke nothing to them without similitudes,

35.verse: to fulfil that which was spoken by the prophet, saying, I will open my mouth in similitudes, and will speak forth things which have been kept secret from the beginning of the world.

36.verse: Then Jesus sent the people away and went indoors. And his disciples came to him, saying, Explain to us the similitude of the tares of the field.

37.verse: Then he answered and said to them, He who sows the good seed is the Son of man.

38.verse: And the field is the world. And the children of the kingdom, they are the good seed. And the tares are the children of the wicked one:

39.verse: the enemy who sows them is the devil. The harvest is the end of the world, and the reapers are the angels.

40.verse: For even as the tares are gathered and burned in the fire, so shall it be in the end of this world.

41.verse: The Son of man will send forth his angels, and they will gather out of his kingdom all injurious things, and those who do iniquity,

42.verse: and will cast them into a furnace of fire. There shall be wailing and gnashing of teeth.

43.verse: Then shall the just shine as bright as the sun in the kingdom of their Father. Whoever has ears to hear, let him hear!

44.verse: Again, the kingdom of heaven is like treasure hid in a field, which a person finds and hides, and for the joy of it goes and sells all that he has and buys that field.

45.verse: Again, the kingdom of heaven is like a merchant who seeks good pearls,

46.verse: who, when he found one precious pearl, went and sold all that he had and bought it.

47.verse: Again, the kingdom of heaven is like a net cast into the sea, which gathers in all kinds of fishes.

48.verse: When it is full, men draw it to land, and sit and gather the good into vessels, and cast the bad away.

49.verse: So shall it be at the end of the world: the angels will come out and separate the bad from the good,

50.verse: and will cast them into a furnace of fire. There will be wailing and gnashing of teeth.

51.verse: Jesus asked them, Do you understand all these things? They said, Yes, Lord.

52.verse: Then he said to them, Therefore every scribe who is instructed in the kingdom of heaven is like a householder who brings forth out of his treasure things both new and old.

53.verse: And it came to pass, when Jesus had finished these similitudes, that he departed from there,

54.verse: and went into his own country. And he taught the people in their synagogues, insomuch that they were astonished and said, Whence comes all this wisdom and power to him?

55.verse: Is this not the carpenter’s son? Is his mother not called Mary? and his brethren James, Joses, Simon, and Judas?

56.verse: Are his sisters not all here with us? Where does he have all these things from?

57.verse: And they were offended by him. Then Jesus said to them, A prophet is not without honour, save in his own country and among his own kin.

58.verse: And he did not do many miracles there, because of their unbelief.

1.verse: John is taken and beheaded. Christ feeds 5,000 men with five loaves and two fishes, and appears to his disciples by night upon the lake. At that time Herod the tetrarch heard of the fame of Jesus

2.verse: and said to his servants, This is John the Baptist; he is risen again from death, and therefore are such miracles wrought by him!

3.verse: For Herod had seized John, and bound him and put him in prison for the sake of Herodias, his brother Philip’s wife.

4.verse: For John said to him, It is not lawful for you to have her.

5.verse: But when Herod would have put him to death, he feared the people, because they counted John as a prophet.

6.verse: But when Herod’s birthday came, the daughter of Herodias danced before them, and pleased Herod,

7.verse: whereupon he promised with an oath that he would give her whatever she would ask.

8.verse: And she, being first instructed by her mother, said, Give me here the head of John the Baptist on a platter.

9.verse: And the king sorrowed. Nevertheless, because of his oath, and because of the people who were sitting also at the table, he commanded it to be given her.

10.verse: And he sent and beheaded John in the prison.

11.verse: And his head was brought on a platter and given to the girl, and she brought it to her mother.

12.verse: And his disciples came and took up his body and buried it, and went and told Jesus.

13.verse: When Jesus heard about this, he withdrew from there by boat into an isolated place out of the way. But when the people heard of it, they followed him by foot out of their towns.

14.verse: And Jesus went forth and saw crowds of people, and his heart did melt upon them. And he healed among them those that were sick.

15.verse: When evening was come, his disciples went to him, saying, This is an isolated place, and the day is spent. Let the people depart so that they can go into the towns and buy themselves some food.

16.verse: But Jesus said to them, They have no need to go away; you give them to eat.

17.verse: Then they said to him, We have here only five loaves and two fishes.

18.verse: And he said, Bring them here.

19.verse: And he directed the people to sit down on the grass, took the five loaves and the two fishes, and looked up to heaven, and blessed, and broke and gave the loaves to his disciples, and the disciples gave them to the people.

20.verse: And they did all eat, and were satisfied. And of the pieces that remained, they gathered twelve baskets full.

21.verse: And the men that had eaten were in number about 5,000, as well as women and children.

22.verse: Directly after, Jesus got his disciples to get into a boat, and to go over before him while he sent the people away.

23.verse: And as soon as he had sent the people away, he went up into a mountain alone to pray. And when night was come, he was there himself alone.

24.verse: And the boat was now in the middle of the sea, and was tossed with waves, for it was a contrary wind.

25.verse: In the fourth watch of the night Jesus went out to them, walking on the sea.

26.verse: And when his disciples saw him walking on the water, they were troubled, saying, It is some spirit! And they cried out for fear.

27.verse: And straightaway Jesus spoke to them, saying, Be of good cheer, it is I. Be not afraid.

28.verse: Peter answered him and said, Master, if it is you, get me to come to you on the water.

29.verse: And he said, Come! And when Peter had gone down out of the boat, he walked on the water to go to Jesus.

30.verse: But when he saw a mighty wind, he was afraid. And as he began to sink he cried out, saying, Master, save me!

31.verse: And immediately Jesus stretched forth his hand and caught him, and said to him, O you of little faith, why did you doubt?

32.verse: And as soon as they were in the boat, the wind ceased.

33.verse: Then the men in the boat came and worshipped him, saying, Of a truth, you are the Son of God.

34.verse: And when they had crossed over, they went into the land of Gennesaret.

35.verse: When the men of that place learned of him, they sent out into all the area round about, and brought to him all that were sick,

36.verse: and asked him if they might touch the hem of his vesture only. And as many as touched it were made well.

1.verse: Christ defends his disciples, and rebukes the scribes and Pharisees for transgressing God’s commandments through their own precepts. What goes into the mouth does not defile a man. He delivers the Canaanite woman’s daughter, heals the multitude, and with seven loaves and a few little fishes feeds 4,000 men, as well as women and children. Then scribes and Pharisees from Jerusalem came to Jesus, saying,

2.verse: Why do your disciples transgress the precepts of the elders? For they do not wash their hands when they eat bread.

3.verse: He answered and said to them, And why do you transgress the commandment of God through your precepts?

4.verse: For God commanded, saying, Honour your father and mother, and, He who curses father or mother shall suffer death.

5.verse: But you say every man should tell his father or mother, That which you desire of me, to help you with, is given for God –

6.verse: and so he should not honour his father or mother. And thus you have made the commandment of God to be without effect, through your precepts.

7.verse: Hypocrites, well did Isaiah prophesy of you, saying,

8.verse: This people draws near to me with their mouths, and honours me with their lips, but their hearts are far from me.

9.verse: And in vain they worship me, teaching doctrines which are nothing but men’s precepts.

10.verse: And he called the people to him and said to them, Hear and understand:

11.verse: that which goes into the mouth does not defile a man, but that which comes out of the mouth defiles a man.

12.verse: Then his disciples came and said to him, Do you perceive how the Pharisees are offended in hearing this saying?

13.verse: He answered and said, All plants that my heavenly Father has not planted shall be plucked up by the roots.

14.verse: Let them alone. They are the blind leaders of the blind. If the blind lead the blind, both will fall into the ditch.

15.verse: Then Peter answered and said to him, Explain the parable to us.

16.verse: Jesus said, Are you still without understanding?

17.verse: Do you not see that whatever goes in at the mouth descends down into the stomach, and is cast out into the drain?

18.verse: But those things which proceed out of the mouth come from the heart, and they defile the person.

19.verse: For out of the heart come evil thoughts, murder, breaking of wedlock, whoredom, theft, bearing of false witness, slander.

20.verse: These are the things that defile a person. But to eat with unwashed hands does not defile a person.

21.verse: And Jesus went from there, and withdrew to the coasts of Tyre and Sidon.

22.verse: And a woman who was a Canaanite came out of the same region and cried out to him, saying, Have mercy on me, Lord Son of David! My daughter is piteously vexed with a devil.

23.verse: But he gave her never a word in answer. Then his disciples came to him and urged him, saying, Send her away; she is following us, crying.

24.verse: He answered and said, I am not sent but to the lost sheep of the house of Israel.

25.verse: Then she came and worshipped him, saying, Master, help me!

26.verse: He answered and said, It is not good to take the children’s bread and to cast it to dogs.

27.verse: She answered and said, True, Lord; nevertheless, the dogs eat of the crumbs that fall from their master’s table.

28.verse: Then Jesus answered and said to her, O woman, great is your faith! Let it be unto you even as you desire. And her daughter was made whole even at that same hour.

29.verse: Then Jesus went away from there, and came near to the Sea of Galilee,

30.verse: and went up on a mountain and sat down there. And crowds of people came to him, having with them people who were lame, blind, dumb, maimed, and many others, and put them down at Jesus’ feet.

31.verse: And he healed them, and the people were in wonderment to see the dumb speak, the maimed whole, the lame walking, and the blind seeing. And they glorified the God of Israel.

32.verse: Then Jesus called his disciples to him and said, I have compassion on the people, because they have continued with me now for three days, and have nothing to eat. I do not want to let them go away without eating, lest they faint along the road.

33.verse: And his disciples said to him, Where could we get enough bread in this remote place to feed such a great number of people?

34.verse: And Jesus said to them, How many loaves do you have? And they said, Seven, and a few little fishes.

35.verse: And he directed the people to sit down on the ground,

36.verse: and took the seven loaves and the fishes, and gave thanks, and broke them, and gave them to his disciples; and the disciples gave them to the people.

37.verse: And they did all eat, and were satisfied. And of the pieces left over they took up seven baskets full –

38.verse: and yet those who ate were 4,000 men, as well as women and children.

39.verse: And Jesus sent the people away, boarded the boat, and went to the region of Magdala.

1.verse: The Pharisees seek a sign. Jesus warns his disciples of the Pharisees’ doctrine. Peter’s confession. The keys of heaven. The faithful must bear their cross after Christ. Then the Pharisees and Sadducees came and tempted Jesus, asking him to show them some sign from heaven.

2.verse: He answered and said to them, At evening you say the weather will be fair, and that because the sky is red;

3.verse: and in the morning you say it will be bad weather today, and that because the sky is cloudy and red. O ye hypocrites, you can discern the aspect of the sky, and can you not discern the signs of the times?

4.verse: The froward and adulterous nation seeks a sign, but no other sign shall be given to them than the sign of the prophet Jonah. So he left them, and departed.

5.verse: And when his disciples had come to the other side of the water, they had forgotten to take bread with them.

6.verse: Then Jesus said to them, Take heed, and beware of the leaven of the Pharisees and of the Sadducees.

7.verse: And they thought in themselves, saying, It is because we have brought no bread with us.

8.verse: When Jesus understood this, he said to them, O ye of little faith, why are your minds cumbered because you have brought no bread?

9.verse: Do you not yet perceive? Nor remember those five loaves when there were 5,000 men, and how many baskets you took up?

10.verse: Nor the seven loaves when there were 4,000, and how many baskets you took up?

11.verse: Why do you not perceive then that I was not speaking to you about bread when I said to beware of the leaven of the Pharisees and of the Sadducees?

12.verse: Then they understood that he was not telling them to beware of the leaven of bread, but of the doctrine of the Pharisees and of the Sadducees.

13.verse: When Jesus arrived in the vicinity of the city which is called Caesarea Phillippi, he asked his disciples, saying, Who do men say that I, the Son of man, am?

14.verse: They said, Some say you are John the Baptist, some Elijah, some Jeremiah, or one of the prophets.

15.verse: He said to them, But who do you say that I am?

16.verse: Simon Peter answered and said, You are Christ, the Son of the living God.

17.verse: And Jesus answered and said to him, Blessed are you, Simon son of Jonah, for flesh and blood has not revealed that to you, but my Father who is in heaven.

18.verse: And I say also to you that you are Peter, and upon this rock I will build my congregation. And the gates of hell shall not prevail against it.

19.verse: And I will give to you the keys of the kingdom of heaven: whatever you bind upon earth shall be bound in heaven, and whatever you loose on earth shall be loosed in heaven.

20.verse: Then he charged his disciples to tell no one that he was Jesus the Christ.

21.verse: From that time on, Jesus began to explain to his disciples how he must go to Jerusalem and suffer many things from the elders, and from the high priests and from the scribes, and must be killed, and rise up again the third day.

22.verse: But Peter took him aside and began to rebuke him, saying, Master, spare yourself! This should not happen to you.

23.verse: Then Jesus turned about and said to Peter, Get behind me, Satan! You offend me, because you savour not the things of God, but things of the world.

24.verse: Jesus then said to his disciples, If any person would follow me, let him deny himself, and take up his cross and follow me.

25.verse: For whosoever would save his life, will lose it. And whosoever loses his life for my sake, will find it.

26.verse: What will it profit a man, though he should win all the whole world, if he loses his own soul? Or, what can a man give to redeem his soul?

27.verse: For the Son of man will come in the glory of his Father with his angels, and then shall he reward every person according to his deeds.

28.verse: Truly I say to you, some there are among them that stand here who shall not taste of death till they have seen the Son of man come in his kingdom.

1.verse: The transfiguration of Christ upon the Mount of Tabor. He heals the frenzied boy, and pays the tribute levy to Rome. And after six days Jesus took Peter, James, and James’ brother John, and brought them up into a high mountain out of the way.

2.verse: And he was transfigured before them. And his face did shine like the sun, and his clothes were as white as the light.

3.verse: And behold, there appeared to them Moses and Elijah, talking with him.

4.verse: Then Peter spoke and said to Jesus, Master, it is good for us to be here. If you will, let us make here three tabernacles: one for you, and one for Moses, and one for Elijah.

5.verse: While he was yet speaking, behold, a bright cloud covered them. And behold, there came a voice out of the cloud, saying, This is my dear Son, in whom I delight. Hear him!

6.verse: When the disciples heard this, they fell on their faces and were sore afraid.

7.verse: And Jesus came and touched them and said, Arise, and do not be afraid.

8.verse: And when they looked up, they saw no one but Jesus only.

9.verse: And as they came down from the mountain, Jesus charged them, saying, See that you tell no one about the vision until the Son of man is risen up again from death.

10.verse: And his disciples asked of him, saying, Why then do the scribes say that Elijah must come first?

11.verse: Jesus answered and said to them, Elijah does come first, and restore all things.

12.verse: And I say to you that Elijah has come already, and they did not know him, but have done to him whatever they pleased. In like manner will the Son of man also suffer at their hands.

13.verse: Then the disciples perceived that he was speaking to them of John the Baptist.

14.verse: And when they had come to the people, a certain man came to Jesus and kneeled down to him and said,

15.verse: Master, have mercy on my son, for he is delirious, and is sorely vexed. And often he falls into the fire, and often into the water.

16.verse: And I brought him to your disciples, but they could not heal him.

17.verse: Jesus answered and said, O generation faithless and perverse, how long shall I be with you? How long shall I suffer you? Bring him here to me.

18.verse: And Jesus rebuked the devil, and he came out of him. And the child was healed even at that same hour.

19.verse: Then the disciples came to Jesus privately and asked, Why could we not cast him out?

20.verse: Jesus said to them, Because of your unbelief. For I say truly to you, if you had faith like a grain of mustard seed, you could say to this mountain, Move over there, and it would move; neither should anything be impossible for you to do.

21.verse: However, this kind does not go out but by prayer and fasting.

22.verse: As they passed the time in Galilee, Jesus said to them, The Son of man will be betrayed into the hands of men,

23.verse: and they will kill him; and the third day he will rise again. And they sorrowed greatly.

24.verse: And when they had come to Capernaum, men that collected the poll money came to Peter and asked, Does your teacher pay tribute?

25.verse: He said, Yes. And when he had come into the house, Jesus spoke first to him, saying, What do you think, Simon: from whom do the kings of the earth take tribute or poll money? From their children, or from others?

26.verse: Peter answered, From others. And Jesus said to him, Then the children are free.

27.verse: Nevertheless, lest we offend them, go to the sea and cast in your hook, and take the fish that first comes up. And when you have opened its mouth, you will find a coin. Take it, and pay for me and you.

1.verse: He teaches his disciples to be humble and harmless, to avoid occasions of inducement to sin, and to forgive one another their offences. At that time the disciples came to Jesus, saying, Who is the greatest in the kingdom of heaven?

2.verse: Jesus called a child to him, and set him in the midst of them,

3.verse: and said, Truly I say to you, unless you turn and become as children, you cannot enter into the kingdom of heaven.

4.verse: Whoever therefore humbles himself like this child, the same is the greatest in the kingdom of heaven.

5.verse: And whoever receives such a child in my name, receives me.

6.verse: But whoever hurts one of these little ones who believe in me, it would be better for him if a millstone were hung about his neck and that he were drowned in the depth of the sea.

7.verse: Woe be to the world because of offences. However, it cannot be avoided but that offences will come. Nevertheless, woe be to the man by whom the offence comes.

8.verse: And so if your hand or your foot causes you to offend, cut it off and cast it from you. It is better for you to enter into life lame or maimed than for you, having two hands or two feet, to be cast into everlasting fire.

9.verse: And if also your eye causes you to offend, tear it out and cast it from you. It is better for you to enter into life with one eye than, having two eyes, to be cast into hell fire.

10.verse: See that you do not despise one of these little ones. For I say to you that in heaven their angels always behold the face of my Father who is in heaven.

11.verse: Yea, and the Son of man has come to save that which is lost.

12.verse: What do you think: if a man has a hundred sheep and one of them has gone astray, does he not leave the ninety-nine in the mountains and go and seek that one which has gone astray?

13.verse: If it happens that he finds it, truly I say to you, he rejoices more over that sheep than over the ninety-nine that did not go astray.

14.verse: In the same way, it is not the will of your Father in heaven that one of these little ones should perish.

15.verse: Moreover, if your brother trespasses against you, go and tell him his fault between him and you alone. If he hears you, you have redeemed your brother.

16.verse: But if he does not hear you, then take along with you one or two others, so that in the mouth of two or three witnesses every matter may be established.

17.verse: If he does not hear them, tell it to the congregation. If he does not hear the congregation, take him as a heathen man and as a publican.

18.verse: Truly I say to you, whatever you bind on earth shall be bound in heaven, and whatever you loose on earth shall be loosed in heaven.

19.verse: Again I say to you, if two of you agree in earth about any manner of thing, whatsoever they desire, it shall be given them by my Father who is in heaven.

20.verse: For where two or three are gathered together in my name, there am I in the midst of them.

21.verse: Then Peter came to him and said, Master, how often should I forgive my brother if he sins against me? Seven times?

22.verse: Jesus said to him, I say to you, not seven times, but seventy times seven times.

23.verse: Therefore the kingdom of heaven is likened to a certain king who wished to take accounts from his servants.

24.verse: And when he had begun the reckoning, one was brought to him who owed him 10,000 talents.
